Amazon Product Profile.Product_Title: iPad Keyboard Case for iPad 2018 (6th Gen) - iPad 2017 (5th Gen) - iPad Pro 9.7 - iPad Air 2&1-360 Rotatable - Wireless/BT - Backlit 7 Colors - iPad Case with Keyboard for iPad OS (9.7, Black)

Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Text: This is a $80 product which is not cheap so I am going to try to be as thorough as possible with this review as I feel that the current reviews are lacking insight. I am going to split this review into 3 sections: The Good, The Neutral, and The Bad. Keep in mind that as of the writing of this review, I have had the keyboard for only a few hours and will be updating this review in the future if something comes up.The Good-Pairing: The keyboard is easy to pair and connects pretty fast every time you turn it on.-USB C: Charges through USB C which means you don‚Äôt have to struggle when plugging it in.-Keyboard: The characters show up instantly when typing so there‚Äôs no need to worry about latency. There are also plenty of useful keys on the very top row which controls music, screen brightness, volume, etc.-Hinge: Being able to rotate the screen is super useful when you want to write/draw something with the Apple Pencil and also for watching videos.-Removable case: The ability to remove the rubber case which houses the iPad and Apple Pencil is really nice for those who don‚Äôt want to carry around the added weight of the keyboard.The Neutral-Round keys: If you are a decent typist and you are familiar with the regular QWERTY keyboard layout, you wont have a problem adjusting to the keyboard.-Trackpad: It has a clickable area on the bottom area which is split into a left click and a right click. The reason this is in the ‚ÄúNeutral‚Äù section and not the ‚ÄúGood‚Äù section is because there seems to be an issue where the cursor moves all over the place when typing but I have found that disabling the trackpad (Top row key) and making sure your palms don‚Äôt touch the trackpad can help with this issue. Another thing that is annoying is that some of the gestures do not work. However, I‚Äôm hopeful that these issues are an IPadOS issues which can be resolved through software updates and not due to the design of the keyboard.-Weight Distribution: The case will tip over if you adjust it at anything more than About 100 degrees in the ‚Äúlaptop‚Äù position but I cant really knock any points off because the only solution to this would be to increase the weight of the keyboard which would probably make it a burden to carry.-Build Quality: It‚Äôs okay but we‚Äôll have to see how it holds up over time.The Bad-Pen Holder: Seriously? This would not be an issue if the holder was place on the side of the iPad where the volume rockers are! This alone is making me knock the overall rating down to 4 stars. When you place the Apple Pencil in the holder, it blocks the power button which isn‚Äôt a big deal when waking up the iPad but gets very annoying when trying to put it to sleep. This wouldn‚Äôt be a big deal if the case had an automatic sleep/wake feature when closing it but it doesn‚Äôt so if you have an Apple Pencil, be prepared to struggle.I hope my Insights are helpful to those who are on the fence of buying this product.

Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Title: Perfect for turning your tablet into a mini computer!
Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Text: I love this keyboard case! I was worried that it wouldn‚Äôt work for what I wanted but it‚Äôs perfect! I‚Äôm excited to use this for work and for my clinical rotations so I don‚Äôt have to carry around my 15 inch MacBook Pro.  It‚Äôs sturdy but not too heavy! It protects my iPad without causing it to be super bulky. I love love love the fact that there is a touch pad! I looked online for awhile and had trouble finding one that had both the keyboard and the touchpad for my iPad generation. So far the battery life seems good and I had no issue connecting it to Bluetooth and getting the keyboard/ touchpad to work. I totally recommend this for anyone who wants to turn their tablet into a mini computer!

Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Title: Okay, so, I'm happy with it, but I want to let you know a few things
Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Text: Perfect fit for my model of iPad, definitely check that this is the right size for you. Second, it's very lightweight, and compact, which is perfect for my use, but that means if you tilt at certain angles, it will tip. Again, perfect for me, but be aware settlement on your intended use.The backlight on the keyboards can be different colors and brightness, including off (if you hit the fn key when hitting the backlight key). Great for my use. Also, the keys are round, which is odd for me, but still plenty easy to type with.MOST IMPORTANT: to get the touchpad to work correctly, you need to allow adaptive touch devices in Settings/Adaptability.I'm quite pleased. Only 3 hours of work time on the battery, but that's about what I was going to get from a cheap laptop anyway. Perfect for me üòä

I bought this case for the touchpad feature and the fact it is a hard case that‚Äôs hinged.  I like it is self supported and doesn‚Äôt  need a brace in the back to hold up the screen.  It‚Äôs heavy.  Bluetooth connectivity and key inputs are instant.  They are rounded keys which takes some getting used to, but good.  One note, if you open up the case too far for viewing, it gets top heavy and wants to tip over.  Not a big deal, but minor annoyance.  The touchpad works as it should.  It‚Äôs touchpad is convenient when using on the run, although a mouse would probably be easier to navigate and more precise.  The charging cord is way too short,  you basically need to charge within inches of a power outlet.  The backlit keys are a nice touch.  I like that the hinge is versatile enough to allow the iPad to sit flat on the keyboard  for those times you don‚Äôt need the keyboard yet don‚Äôt want to remove the iPad from the case. Overall it is a good value for all the features you get,  especially if you need a hard protective case with a touchpad.  I would buy again.

Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Title: Trust me, this case is a 10!
Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Text: Want to use your iPad like a laptop? This is the case for you!I normally don‚Äôt take the time to do reviews, but this keyboard case is so good, I just had to!Pros: backlit keyboard with several color choices; swivel hinge for multiple viewing angles (even tablet mode while still in the case)!Soft texture allows you to grip without it slipping easily; Detachable iPad cover (you can pull your iPad out and use it independently with a border case and stylus holder!)Did i mention the trackpad with control gestures! C‚Äômon, you have to ‚Äúgive it up‚Äù for that!This keyboard charges via USB C.Large size ‚Äúshift‚Äù key on right side (You may not realize how important that is until you start typing regularly on the keyboard)Cons: round keys take a little while to get used to....but no problemYou have to be careful where you place your hands and thumbs while you type. Sometimes you could hit the trackpad by mistake while typing.(Note: I did not receive any compensation or discount for this review)

This is an excellent keyboard. The touch pad is very sensitive and I‚Äôve found that I have to turn it off whenever I want to actually type something. Otherwise I have no idea where I‚Äôm typing as the touch pad will move the insert cursor all over the place merely by hovering over the pad. I don‚Äôt know of any way to really adjust that without affecting the overall usefulness of the touchpad. Just remember to turn it back on when you are through typing. (One toggle key in the top row.)

Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Title: The ONLY option that checks all the boxes for the 9.7‚Äù ipad
Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Text: So they make stuff like this for the newer 10‚Äù iPad but this is the ONLY option for the older 9.7‚Äù versions. My requirements: hard hinge (stays open like a laptop), physical keyboard, pencil holder. This is the only option out there. The typewriter style circle keys are a bit funky but u get used to it after a few minutes. If u have a 9.7‚Äù and want those 3 features this is your only option. Plenty of other options with pencil holder but they all require a ‚Äòkickstand‚Äô back to keep the screen up so won‚Äôt really work on your lap.

My old trusty favormates case was falling apart, so I bought this one. I LOVE IT. It is cute and actually one of the more sturdy keyboard cases I‚Äôve used (iPad obsessed since 2010). The keyboard is pretty comfortable, and the pen holder is a nice touch. My only complaint would be that the keyboard does get a little finicky after being idle for a little while. A simple off/on fixes that tho.

Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Text: I've never purchased anything without any reviews. Was honestly very surprised that it's as good as it is. I love the convenience of this product and the sleekness of it. What I don‚Äôt like is the sensitivity of the mouse when the keyboard‚Äôs battery life is getting low. Sometimes the keyboard with ‚Äúunsync‚Äù with the iPad and you have to cut the keyboard on and off to get the iPad to respond. Also the keyboard KILLS the iPad‚Äôs battery life so keep a charger close. Those few kinks need to be updated but I‚Äôd still recommend this product. I‚Äôd definitely recommend!

Let me start off by saying this case is great and If it did not break my Ipad i would have given it a 5 star. My brother has the 7th gen ipad and a case similar to this one and this one is by far better. The buttons I was unsure about but were better then my previous case and my brothers similar case from a different manufacturer. The rounded buttons I thought would be a detractor but are actually better then the squared off imo.Now on to the bad. While never having a crack or scratch on this ipad (Or any device I have ever owned) .While pressing in the ipad from the rubber casing( that comes with the case) to the actual case. The pressure this must have caused cracked my screen and made it spider all over the device. Fortunately the device is still usable but my plan was to use this device to show off projects to investors. Now with a broken screen I will be forced to go buy a new Ipad I can not afford due to the pandemic...... thanks guys.This was a 5th gen ipad.Also the pen holster should be detachable. My device can not use use the apple pen Which makes the feature pointless. Only 6th gen can use the Apple Pencil.

Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Title: Overall Fail ‚Äî Did Not Protect My iPad
Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Text: I really wanted to like this keyboard case.  But, I have now dropped it twice, and both times the case survived just fine, but the iPad did not do so well.  The first drop was off my washing machine ‚Äî 3 ft drop to linoleum.  This broke the home button on my iPad.  The right side of the case is not protected well at all ‚Äî Just a flimsy bit of rubber from the inner case.  The outer hard case does not cover the sides at all.The second drop was about 3 ft onto pavement.  This broke my Apple Pencil, which is now useless.  Storing the Apple Pencil via a clip on the outside of the case is a terrible idea.For the most part, I like the keyboard, but it also has some concerns:* The trackpad is automatically on when the keyboard turns on.  This is very inconvenient, as it interferes with typing.* The keyboard often snoozes and loses connection.  The only way to get connection back is to turn the keyboard off then back on again.Other than those two issues, I like the keyboard very much ‚Äî good layout, etc.But, the number one function of a keyboard case is to protect the iPad.  This one utterly failed at that.I have had several cases for this iPad.  This is the only one that has allowed my iPad to be damaged by a drop.

Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Title: Think twice before purchasing this item.
Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Text: I purchased two of these cases for my daughters‚Äô 9.7 inch tablets in September. I loved the fact that it uses a USB-C to charge, that it came in rose gold, and that it has a trackpad. However, the trackpad is way too sensitive and the case is not sturdy. I am shocked that between September to today, the cases are now breaking. I‚Äôve attached two photos so that you can see the point in which it breaks. It is resulting from using the case by opening the device. I would highly recommend you not purchase this device as it has not held up for even a year through distance learning for my girls.

Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Title: Keys fell off on first use
Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Text: I tried this product in the black color and a couple of the keys fell off during my first use. I also bought a pink one, which seems to have sturdier keys for some reason. I've used the pink one now for several weeks and no issues, except I wish it wasn't pink.

Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Title: Didn‚Äôt come complete as shown, so incomplete/ embarrassing Xmas gift.
Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Text: Bought this case as a gift for daughters IPad to use w/ a specific learning App that needed a pen-keyboard.  Came without pen, spent hours Christmas looking for it through the packaging.  Long story short, item was incomplete & is pretty much useless for what I got it for.
Had some issues with my battery. Looks like it‚Äôs leaking or something. Has caused a lot of damage to the case. I‚Äôve barely used it all and this is what‚Äôs happened to it. Be careful with it.

Piece of garbage. The cover for the latch broke off 2 days after the return policy ended. Short battery life. If you want a keyboard and mouse pad really should upgrade to newer iPads than 6th gen since the 6th gen doesn‚Äôt have smart connector. Don‚Äôt bother buying this.

Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Title: Not crazy about the round keys
Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Text: Didn‚Äôt like the round keys or rubber on the outside of the case. Case was more like a thick plastic than a metal.
I could not work with it properly, it was uncomfortable and the lights changing drove me mad....

Loved it at first bc my daughter needed a keyboard to do her schoolwork BUT after barely 2 months of use, the piece where it rotates, snapped off. Useless now. It won't close at all or pivot on the closing hinge.Pass. Cost too much top barely last 2 month. Other than that we liked the colors and battery life.

Let me start off by saying this case is great and If it did not break my Ipad i would have given it a 5 star. My brother has the 7th gen ipad and a case similar to this one and this one is by far better. The buttons I was unsure about but were better then my previous case and my brothers similar case from a different manufacturer. The rounded buttons I thought would be a detractor but are actually better then the squared off imo.Now on to the bad. While never having a crack or scratch on this ipad (Or any device I have ever owned) .While pressing in the ipad from the rubber casing( that comes with the case) to the actual case. The pressure this must have caused cracked my screen and made it spider all over the device. Fortunately the device is still usable but my plan was to use this device to show off projects to investors. Now with a broken screen I will be forced to go buy a new Ipad I can not afford due to the pandemic...... thanks guys.This was a 5th gen ipad.Also the pen holster should be detachable. My device can not use use the apple pen Which makes the feature pointless. Only 6th gen can use the Apple Pencil.

Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Title: Cursos moves all over without reason
Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Text: I just purchased the keyboard and many things work good, but I have a problem; when I type, the cursor constantly jumps all over and ruins my typing, closes windows, goes to other apps, etc. and ruins the functionality of it as I am constantly stoping to correct mistakes. Do yo have a suggested fix? Otherwise, I will have to return it.
So I was very excited for this product turns out to be too heavy it also interferes with other Bluetooth devices so you can probably just connect this keyboard to your iPad nothing else

Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Title: I do not recommend buying this keyboard after 3 months the top part came off the bottom.
Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Text: I bought this keyboard for my daughter in October and also paid 10 dollars for the insurance that I never received anything in the mail. Now my daughter has broken the part that connects the keyboard with the screen and I have no information about anything to make the claim. Terrible this product. Expensive and does not last at all.

Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Title: This product is well built and works very well with modification.
Amazon Product Reviews.Review_Text: The cutout on the case for the power button does not fit correctly on iPad pro 9.7 first generation. I had to trim it by 1/8 of an inch and it works fine now. Otherwise it holds pressure on the power button and causes problems.

This keyboard lasted about two weeks before the keys started falling off and the hinge gave out. It was never super sturdy to begin with. I missed the window to return it to see if maybe we just ended up with a dud. But based on my experience, I‚Äôd keep looking!
But really heavy on its own
We liked the touchpad but thought the keyboard was to small. We thought this would give us the feeling of a laptop, but for our needs it fell short of that goal.
Could not support itself when IPad was leaning backwards.  Returned it the next day.
